newsitem.title: UK: Wessex Water maintains cost cut momentum.
newsitem.headline: Wessex Water maintains cost cut momentum.

text.p: Wessex Water is confident of maintaining the momentum of cost cuts in its water business and therefore reducing charges to customers, chairman Nicholas Hood told the annual meeting.
He said the proposed takeover of South West Water would bring "considerable benefits," but added that the company would not make a bid if regulatory and competition requirements were too demanding.
"Insted, we will proceed with other options to deliver higher returns to shareholders," he said.
Wessex Water's bid for South West Water, along with a rival offer from Severn Trent, is currently being considered by UK competition authorities.
Hood said that no more executive share options wold be granted to directors but that the board was seeking approval to offer a new long term incentive plan to executives.
